summary: Add a new PLAYERS' DOCUMENTS section with per-document privacy controls (hide from others vs shared).
architectural_notes: Implement per-document visibility rule: when marked Private, only the owner (and optionally the client) can see it; when not private, behaves like shared docs (visible/editable to all members).

existing_features.title: Add a new sidebar section directly below the existing "Documents" section titled "PLAYERS' DOCUMENTS" that lists player-owned documents for the current session and allows selecting a player document to open it in the main panel.

Update the Session page navigation/state so it supports selecting and rendering a player document in the main panel (in addition to channels and shared documents), using the existing PlayerDocumentEditorView for the selected player document.

Add a simple per-player-document privacy control as a toggle/checkbox labeled "Private" (or "Hide from others") for the document owner; when enabled, the document is not visible to any other session members; when disabled, the document is visible and behaves like a shared doc for viewing/editing (as allowed by the appâ€™s current permissions model).

new_feature_requests.summary: Add 'PLAYERS' DOCUMENTS' section below DOCUMENTS with per-player document privacy toggle (Private/Hide from others) that hides docs from other members when enabled; shared docs remain visible/editable by everyone.
Enforce privacy on the backend so that when a player document is marked Private/hidden, only the document owner can fetch its content (and it is excluded from list responses for non-owners).

projectName: Add Players' Documents sidebar section and per-document privacy toggle
